content: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><modsCollection rowCount="1"><mods><identifier type="pw">fs20073039</identifier><identifier type="pwpk">80255</identifier><identifier type="series">Fact Sheet</identifier><identifier type="seriesNumber">2007-3039</identifier><identifier type="seriesCode">FS</identifier><genre>USGS Numbered Series</genre><titleInfo><title>Assessment of Undiscovered Oil and Gas Resources in Cretaceous-Tertiary Coal Beds of the Gulf Coast Region, 2007</title></titleInfo><originInfo><dateOther>Fri, 24 Aug 2007 00:00 -0500</dateOther><dateIssued>2007</dateIssued><publisher>Geological Survey (U.S.)</publisher></originInfo><name><namePart>Warwick, Peter D.</namePart><role>Author</role></name><abstract>Using a geology-based assessment methodology, the U.S. Geological Survey estimated a mean of 4.06 trillion cubic feet of undiscovered, technically recoverable natural gas in Cretaceous-Tertiary coal beds of the onshore lands and State waters of the Gulf Coast.</abstract><physicalDescription><form>2 p.</form><form>Geological Survey (U.S.)</form></physicalDescription><location><url note="THUMBNAIL">http://pubs.er.usgs.gov/thumbnails/fs_2007_3039.jpg</url><url displayLabel="html" note="INDEX PAGE">http://pubs.usgs.gov/fs/2007/3039/</url></location><note type="citation/reference">Assessment of Undiscovered Oil and Gas Resources in Cretaceous-Tertiary Coal Beds of the Gulf Coast Region, 2007; 2007; FS; 2007-3039; Fact Sheet; Warwick, Peter D.</note><edition>Version 1.0</edition><languageTerm>ENGLISH</languageTerm><relatedItem type="original"><titleInfo><title>Fact Sheet</title></titleInfo></relatedItem></mods></modsCollection>
